page.title: 02Farming, Hellangove Farm 2
page.content: The framer has no son to hand over to. In the past 6 or 7 men would have been employed. The farm labourer came from Scotland and was himself a farmers son. He works 7 days a week starting at 8 am and finishing at 10 pm in the summer. He has one hour dinner break and \ hour tea-break. He lives in a caravan. There are no tied cottages. For his basic 40 hours a week he receives Â£88, the rest is overtime at 1\ times the basic rate. The farmer has 2 silage trailors, 4 tractors/ ploughs, cultivators/harrows, milking machines and 2 bulk storage tanks. Today some of the work is contracted out on the farm, mainly lime spreading and occasionally stone picking. Mr Austin the farmer buys in hay.
